alert.note: Alert for Orange County Coastal (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued September 09 at 9:04AM PDT until September 10 at 12:00AM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM PDT THIS EVENING... ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT PDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Hot conditions continue with temperatures up to 96. Strong east winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * WHERE...Orange County Coastal Areas. * WHEN...For the Excessive Heat Warning, until 8 PM PDT this evening. For the Wind Advisory, until midnight PDT tonight. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Extreme heat will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible, reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear light weight and loose fitting clothing when possible and drink plenty of water.
